sentences.sContent: Jie was extremely tyrannical and dissolute.
sentences.sCn: 桀是个极端残暴，放荡的人。

sentences.sContent: Nellie was married twice, the first time to a dissolute diplomat whose death left her a wealthy woman.
sentences.sContent_eng: Nellie was married twice, the first time to a dissolute diplomat whose death left her a wealthy woman.
sentences.sCn: 妮利结过两次婚，第一次嫁给了一个风流的外交官，外交官死后给他留下了大笔财富，使她成为一个有钱的女人。

sentences.sContent: I have also heard that he leads a dissolute lifestyle, but that is probably just a nasty rumor.
sentences.sContent_eng: I have also heard that he leads a dissolute lifestyle, but that is probably just a nasty rumor.
sentences.sCn: 我还听说他生活放荡不羁，但这也许只是恶意的谣言。

words.tran: 放荡地；荒淫地；毫无约束地

trans.tranOther: having an immoral way of life, for example drinking too much alcohol or having sex with many people
